title: Modern Construction Management Engineering Curriculum Reform and Efficient Operation Strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Basic construction management theory and practical field experience
context.additional_context: Reflecting the necessity of revising existing programs (reducing credit hours, supplementing educational content, shortening completion periods).

learning_goals: The construction project management process can be systematically analyzed, and optimal resource allocation strategies can be established.
Construction schedules and costs can be efficiently managed using digital tools (BIM, project management software).
Project success rates can be improved by over 20% by designing risk assessments and response plans for site-specific conditions.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
